required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Orange Juice Consumption and Glucose Metabolism and Antioxidative Status
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Orange Juice Consumption on Glucose Homeostasis and Antioxidative Status in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to investigate the impact of orange juice consumption (with meals or between meals) as well as sugar sweetened beverage (SSB) consumption (between meals) on glucose homeostasis and antioxidative status.

detailed_description.textblock:
Duration of the study is 3x three weeks including one wash-out week each followed by two weeks of juice/SSB consumption under free living conditions.
During wash-out weeks consumption of orange juice or citrus fruits is restricted.
During intervention weeks, participants are asked to eat three regular meals per day without snacking. Intervention weeks are (i) orange juice consumption with meals (ii) orange juice consumption between meals and (iii) SSB consumption between meals. Daily energy intake with orange juice/SSB is 20% of individual energy requirement. Additional caloric beverages (SSB, juice, coffee with sugar/milk, alcohol) are not allowed. At the beginning and the end of each intervention phase insulin sensitivity and antioxidative status are assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: changes in daylong glycaemia between pre and post intervention periods

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in uric acid between pre and post intervention periods
secondary_outcome.description: measured via uric acid serum levels [mg/dL]

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in insulin sensitivity between pre and post intervention periods
secondary_outcome.description: measured via "Matsuda-Index" from oral glucose tolerance test data

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in antioxidative status between pre and post intervention periods
secondary_outcome.description: measured via vitamin c blood levels [mg/L]

arm_group.description: Effect of orange juice consumption with three meals per day (without snacking) on glucose metabolism and antioxidative status
Effect of orange juice consumption between three meals per day (without snacking) on glucose metabolism and antioxidative status
Effect of sugar sweetened beverage consumption between three meals per day (without snacking) on glucose metabolism and antioxidative status

intervention.description: Sugar sweetened beverage (20% of energy requirement/day)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- regular use of medication,
- smoking,
- chronic disease,
- vegan/vegetarian diet,
- fructose intolerance,
- irregular eating behaviour (less then 3 meals/day)

facility.name: Institute of Nutritional Medicine, University of Hohenheim
